Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with left-side colorectal cancer scheduled for elective resection with primary anastomosis were randomized 1 : 1

Participants.evidence: Patients with left-side colorectal cancer scheduled for elective resection with primary anastomosis

Intervention.evidence: randomized 1 : 1 to preoperative mechanical bowel preparation with either oral preparation or rectal enema

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the impact of oral preparation and rectal enema on the gut microbiome and postoperative complications.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was difference in β-diversity between groups on postoperative day 6.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty participants were randomized to oral preparation (20) or rectal enema (20).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The two groups had similar changes in microbiome composition, and there was no difference in β-diversity on postoperative day 6.

Harms.evidence: Postoperative infections occurred in 12 patients (32%), without differences between the study groups.
